results.title: The Sunshine boys
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Adapted from the play by Neil Simon, this film version stars two great actors, Walter Matthau and George Burns, as the two cantankerous old-time vaudevillians who have been persuaded to reunite one more time for a television special, despite the fact that they hate each other. Also stars Richard Benjamin.

results.title: The Immortal battalion = The Way ahead
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Sutro, Norman Walker, Two Cities Films and G C F
results.brief_description: Beginning as a British Army training film called “The New lot”, this film was then expanded into a feature length film written by Eric Ambler and Peter Ustinov, entitled “The Way ahead” for its British audience and re-edited into a slightly shorter film entitled “The Immortal battalion” for an American audience. Its basic concept is as a recruiting and training film for the British Army mixing training and combat footage with filmed sequences. The storyline is about a bunch of raw recruits from a variety of backgrounds who are finally welded into a unified and disciplined regimental unit ready for battle. Stars David Niven, Stanley Holloway, Peter Ustinov, Trevor Howard.

results.title: The Best little whorehouse in Texas [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Colin Higgins, Robert L Boyett, Edward Milkis, Thomas Miller, RKO Radio Pictures and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A sheriff and a proprietess join together not only in romance, but to fight a big city TV crusader in his efforts to expose the Chicken Ranch to public scandal, and thus close it down. Based on the stage play written by Larry L. King and Peter Masterton. Cast includes Burt Reynolds, Dolly Parton, Dom DeLuise, Charles Durning, Jim Nabors, Robert Mandan.

results.title: Air Force One
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Jonathan Shestack, Gail Katz, Armyan Bernstein and Buena Vista International
results.brief_description: Cementing his status as action hero leading man, Harrison Ford plays the United States President who also happens to be a Vietnam War hero. Trapped aboard his private jet, President Marshall must display a steely reserve in the face of unhinged kidnappers. Peterson (In the Line of Fire, The Perfect Storm, Troy) ably directs this mainstream thriller that produces a tangle of twists but lacks the enormous tension generated by his classic wartime nail-biter “Das Boot”. Cast also includes Gary Oldman, Wendy Crewson, Paul Guilfoyle, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell, William H. Macy.

results.title: Betsy's wedding
results.creator_credit: Alan Alda, Martin Bregman, Louis A. Stroller and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Alan Alda, “Betsy’s wedding” is about a father (Alda) who must survive his daughter’s wedding, with all its fractious factions, complications, cost, deal making and emotional turmoil. An intermittently amusing work, with the highlight being Anthony La Paglia’s turn as a mobster’s nephew who falls for the bride’s policewoman sister. Cast also includes Joey Bishop, madeline Kahn, Molly Ringwald, Joe Pesci, Ally Sheedy.

results.title: Candleshoe
results.creator_credit: Norman Tokar, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An adventure story about a noble lady and her orphans fighting to remain in their mansion after being threatened with eviction if the estate taxes are not paid. Lady St Edmund (Helen Hayes), aware of the legend about one of her ancestors supposedly having hidden a treasure of gold coins somewhere in the mansion, unwittingly finds herself a victim of a set-up by two unscrupulous characters, Bundage (Leo McKern) and Grimsworthy (Vivian Pickles), who also want to find the hidden money. Plotting and scheming the pair persuade a young urchin Casey (Jodie Foster), to help them by posing as Lady St Edmund’s long-lost granddaughter. Features David Niven as Priory, Lady St Edmund’s butler, gardener, chauffeur and right-hand man.

results.title: I am a dancer
results.creator_credit: Pierre Jourdan, Evdoros Demetriou, Office de Radiodiffusion Television Francais and Demetrion Productions
results.brief_description: Rudolf Nureyev is considered one of the world’s greatest dancers and this documentary provides an insight to the man, his work and his passion for the art of ballet. Includes segments from four ballets with partners Margot Fonteyn (Marguerite and Armand), Carla Fracci, (La Sylphide), Lynn Seymour (The Sleeping beauty), and Deanne Bergsma (Field figures). A French/British co-production with narration by Bryan Forbes.

results.title: The Shillingbury blowers
results.creator_credit: Val Guest, Greg Smith and Inner Circle Films
results.brief_description: A tale about a quaint English village and its community Brass Band known as the Shillingbury Blowers led by its much loved conductor, Old Saltie (Trevor Howard). Tells of how this rather old-fashioned and conventional village is turned on its head when young pop musician Peter Higgins (Robin Nedwell) and his wife Sally (Diane Keen) move into town. Cast includes Jack Douglas, John Le Mesurier, Patrick Newell, Diane King. Music composed and conducted by Ed Welch.

results.title: The Children of Theatre Street
results.creator_credit: Earle Mack, Robert Dornhelm and Kultur International Films
results.brief_description: Describes life at the Vaganova Choreographic Institute in Leningrad (also known as the Kirov School of Leningrad), formerly the Imperial Ballet School of Russia, which has spawned dancers like Nureyev, Pavlova, Nijinsky, Baryshnikov, and Balanchine. Here at the school, gifted students are trained in classical ballet, using methods that have much in common with the training of ballet students anywhere in the world. Narrated by Princess Grace of Monaco and features Galina Messenzeva and Konstantine Zaklinsky of the Kirov Ballet. Ballet performances filmed and recorded live at the Kirov, Bolshoi and Maly Theatres, USSR.

results.title: White nights
results.creator_credit: Taylor Hackford, William S. Gilmore, New Visions Pictures, Delphi V Productions and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: This Cold War thriller stars real-life dancer Mikhail Baryshnikov as a Russian defector who finds himself trapped in his homeland when his plane crashes in Siberia. Billeted with an American dancer (Gregory Hines), Kolya is desperate to escape and hatches a daring plan but must evade the keen attentions of the KGB. Whilst the plot is fair to middling, the dancing in this feature film is brilliant, making the most of the two lead’s spectacular talents. Also stars Helen Mirren and Isabella Rossellini.
